intro: Kosteletzkya palmata, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes resembling a hand. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in saline environments and is often found in sandy soils near the coast. Kosteletzkya palmata is adapted to withstand salt spray and is a common species in tropical and subtropical coastal areas.
